one one thing that you can get from
looking at the history of
philosophy um philosophers like Spinosa
for example is an emphasis on the
present right and uh Vicken Stein says
somewhere and it's it's it's a it's a
deep remark that the
eternal life is given to those who live
in the
present and living in the present is the
most difficult thing to do uh we we're
always living either in the past which
is a past of whatever a great a glorious
childhood or victimization of suffering
or we're living in a future which is a
future of you know when I will be rich
and famous or whatever it might be we
escape the present and uh you know one
of the things that philosophy can
do I think is to allow one to
emphasize the importance of this this
never recurring transient presence
through which we we live
